SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Strokes due to vertebral artery lesions are not yet well known in children
CASE REPORT: We report on a case of post-traumatic vertebral artery dissection responsible for ischemic stroke in a 8-year old boy
Headache, vomiting and a brief loss of consciousness were the main initial signs
Neurological examination showed a locked-in syndrome
Cerebral imaging revealed lesions in cortical cerebellar hemisphere, cerebral pedoncular and protuberance
An arteriogram performed on day 10 showed left vertebral artery occlusion at C2 levels consistent with vertebral dissection
Pertinent clinical data of 24 children who had strokes due to a vertebral artery dissection are analysed
CONCLUSION: Vertebral artery dissection is presently a well-known cause of childhood strokes
Benefits from anticoagulants are now established
